concise_definition: adj. 学术的, 理论的; n. 学者, 大学教师

definitions.explanation_en: Relating to schools, colleges, or universities, especially in the context of education, research, or theoretical study rather than practical application.
definitions.explanation_cn: 与学校、学院或大学相关的，尤其指教育、研究或理论性学习，而非实际应用。
definitions.example_en: She has an academic background in economics and has published several peer-reviewed papers.
definitions.example_cn: 她拥有经济学的学术背景，并发表了数篇同行评审论文。

definitions.explanation_en: Concerned with theoretical or abstract ideas rather than practical or real-world applications; often implying impracticality or detachment from everyday concerns.
definitions.explanation_cn: 关注理论或抽象概念，而非实际或现实应用；常暗示脱离实际或与日常生活脱节。
definitions.example_en: The debate was purely academic since the policy had already been implemented.
definitions.example_cn: 这场辩论纯属理论性质，因为该政策已经实施了。

definitions.explanation_en: A person who works in higher education, especially as a teacher or researcher at a university or college.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在高等教育机构中工作的人，尤指大学或学院的教师或研究人员。
definitions.example_en: The conference brought together academics from over 20 countries to discuss climate change.
definitions.example_cn: 本次会议汇集了来自二十多个国家的学者，共同探讨气候变化问题。

comparison.analysis: “Scholarly”（学术性的）强调符合学术标准、严谨、基于深入研究，常用于形容态度、写作或方法，如 scholarly article（学术文章）。而 “academic” 更广泛，可指机构、环境或理论倾向，有时带有脱离实际的贬义，而 “scholarly” 通常为褒义。
“Theoretical”（理论的）专指基于理论而非实践，强调缺乏实际应用或验证。而 “academic” 可包含理论性，但更侧重于教育或研究体系的背景，有时可中性使用，如 academic discipline（学术学科）。
“Intellectual”（智力的/知识的）强调思维能力、理性思考或对知识的追求，可形容人、活动或兴趣，如 intellectual curiosity（求知欲）。而 “academic” 更具体地指向教育机构和正式研究体系，范围更窄，且常与制度性环境相关。
